channel.title: Compliation on Errors in Go - Learn how to fix common errors in Go
channel.description: Recent content in Compliation on Errors in Go - Learn how to fix common errors in Go

item.title: this-is-not-used
item.description: What causes the error? This error means that you are trying to use Go’s short form variable declaration (a := "some-value") when the variable has already been declared. The most common cause of this compilation error is when you have a variable declared via short form declaration and then add a new line of code before that line which adds a new declaration. This is much clearer with an example.
